alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 8:01AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 AM EDT, the public reported an Ice Jam one half mile south of the Grand Isle & Lille town line. Minor flooding is already occurring mainly in farm fields with water slowly rising behind the jam. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Eastern areas of Madawaska near Route 1, Grand Isle near Route 1 and Lille near Route 1. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
